sense.gloss: visit (to a religious site, e.g. shrine, temple, grave)
first shrine visit of the New Year
to go, to come, to call
to be defeated, to collapse, to die
to be annoyed, to be nonplussed
visit to a temple or shrine, worship, pilgrimage

r_ele.r: ぞうけいのおくぶかさ

sense.gloss: New Year's visit to a shrine or temple which lies in a favorable (favourable) or lucky direction
worshiper, visitor to temple or shrine

sdata.j: ↑各国↑↓かっこく↓の↑政治↑↓せいじ↓↑家↑↓か↓がホワイトハウス↑詣↑↓もう↓でをした。
sdata.e: Politicians from many countries made pilgrimages to the White House.

sdata.j: ↑初詣↑↓はつもうで↓、ご↑利益↑↓りやく↓があるのはどこの↑神社↑↓じんじゃ↓？
sdata.e: New Year shrine visit; which shrines are potent?

sdata.j: ↑日本↑↓にっぽん↓↑文化↑↓ぶんか↓に↑造詣↑↓ぞうけい↓↑深↑↓ふか↓いことはいいことです。
sdata.e: Being knowledgeable about Japanese culture is a good thing.

sdata.j: ↑初詣↑↓はつもう↓でとは、↑初↑↓はじ↓めて↑詣↑↓もう↓でるという↑意味↑↓いみ↓です。
sdata.e: This is called hatsumode, the first visit to a shrine.

sdata.j: ↑初詣↑↓はつもう↓でとは↑新年↑↓しんねん↓に↑神社↑↓じんじゃ↓にお↑参↑↓まい↓りすることです。
sdata.e: Hatsumoude means New Year's visits to shrines.

sdata.j: ↑神道↑↓しんとう↓の↑最↑↓もっと↓も↑大事↑↓だいじ↓な↑行事↑↓ぎょうじ↓は↑初詣↑↓はつもう↓で、↑多↑↓おお↓くの↑人々↑↓ひとびと↓が↑新年↑↓しんねん↓に↑神社↑↓じんじゃ↓に↑詣↑↓もう↓で、1↑年↑↓ねん↓の↑幸福↑↓こうふく↓と↑健康↑↓けんこう↓を↑祈↑↓いの↓ります。
sdata.e: The most important Shinto event takes place in the New Year, when millions of people visit shrines to pray for happiness and a healthy year.

sdata.j: ↑七↑↓なな↓↑五↑↓ご↓↑三↑↓さん↓は↑11月↑↓じゅういちがつ↓15↑日↑↓にち↓です。↑男↑↓おとこ↓の↑子↑↓こ↓は3↑歳↑↓さい↓と5↑歳↑↓さい↓、↑女↑↓おんな↓の↑子↑↓こ↓は3↑歳↑↓さい↓と7↑歳↑↓さい↓にあたるその↑祭↑↓まつ↓りに、↑子↑↓こ↓どもの↑成長↑↓せいちょう↓を↑祝↑↓いわ↓い、↑晴着↑↓はれぎ↓を↑着↑↓き↓せて↑神社↑↓じんじゃ↓に↑詣↑↓まい↓る。
sdata.e: November 15th is the seven-five-three festival, when parents with boys of five, girls of seven and either boys or girls of three celebrate their children's maturation, dress them in gay clothes and take them to shrines where they pray for their children's future.
